organization.fullName: Hospital Central Sur de Alta Especialidad

identificationModule.briefTitle: Multivariate Analysis of Serum High Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein in Patients With Acute Phase Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: Multivariate Analysis of Serum High Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein in Patients With Acute Phase Stroke

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: Hospital Central Sur de Alta Especialidad

leadSponsor.name: Hospital Central Sur de Alta Especialidad

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Stroke is one of main causes of death and impairment worldwide. Objective of this study is to analyze serum High Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein in acute phase stroke in patients attended at Petróleos Mexicanos Hospital Central Sur de Alta Especialidad and to correlate with stroke extension and clinical features.

conditions: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale
keywords: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale

armGroups.label: stroke
armGroups.description: Patients admitted to hospital who are diagnosed with stroke will be treated as usually a our center by observation, venous or arterial thrombolysis depending on extension, condition, thrombolysis feasibility.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Measure of serum High sensitivity C-Reactive Protein level
primaryOutcomes.description: Serum levels of serum High sensitivity C-Reactive Protein will be measured in patients with suspicion of stroke at the emergency room within the first 8 hours of arrival at our hospital
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: within the first 8 hours since admission to hospital

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale
secondaryOutcomes.description: clinical impact of stroke will be determined by neurology and neurosurgery department at admission to emergency room of our hospital
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: within the first 4 hours since admission to emergency room

otherOutcomes.description: brain image will be taken as soon as possible when patient suspected with stroke arrives to emergency room and after clinical evaluation
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: within the first 4 hours since admission to emergency room

otherOutcomes.description: origin of stroke will be investigated within hospital stay
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: origin will be diagnosed during the hospital stay expecting no more than 1 week

otherOutcomes.description: from arrival of patient to emergency room until discharge
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: hospital stay is expected for no more than 1 week unless intensive care unit is needed

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients suspected of acute phase stroke who arrive to emergency room at our hospital
* Patients affiliated to Petróleos Mexicanos medical system
* Patients of any gender
* Patients between 18 and 80 years old

Exclusion Criteria:

* Stroke provoked by angiographic procedure
* Pregnancy
* Patient under chemotherapy or radiotherapy
* Recently surgery or trauma among last 30 days
* Heparin usage
* Stroke and/ or thrombolysis history
* Active infection
* Liver disease
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients affiliated to Petróleos Mexicanos medical system of any gender between 18 and 80 years old suspected of acute phase stroke who arrive to emergency room at our hospital
